title: â€œI burned her with boiling water inside the college.â€ A brand new resolution within the incident of the scholar â€œCarolineâ€ in Giza â€“ Masrawy â€“ Masrawy
text:
05:30 p.m
Thursday, June 13, 2024
Books â€“ Ramadan Younes:
The Omraniya Misdemeanor Court docket in Giza postponed the primary session of the trial of â€œNajwa A.,â€ an administrative affairs employee at a personal college in Faisal, accused of pouring boiling water on her face â€ Caroline Marks,â€ the sixth. grade pupil whereas she was at school, till the subsequent session June 26, to announce the official fee.
Rifaat Saadan, the lawyer of the scholar â€œCaroline,â€ submitted a civil declare to the Omraniya Misdemeanor Court docket for an quantity of 100,000 kilos as non permanent civil compensation for the injury his consumer suffered from the capturing on her physique.
Earlier, the Public Treasury referred the accused worker to trial earlier than the misdemeanor court docket on allegations of unintentional harm as a consequence of pouring boiling water on the sufferer pupil.
After listening to her statements, the investigative authorities launched an worker in administrative affairs at Dar Al Hanan Personal Faculty within the Faisal district of Giza. After the plaintiff was accused of wrongful harm.
â€œMarcosâ€ stated in statements to Masrawy that the investigating authorities on the Omraniya Prosecutorâ€™s Workplace heard the statements of the principal of the college and his daughter and his daughter, the scholar â€œCaroline,â€ about how she suffered burns within the second grade contained in the schoolyard. This occurred after sizzling water was poured on her face and proper shoulder â€œThe employee stated she did not imply it,â€ in response to Mark, the scholarâ€™s father.
â€œMarcosâ€ defined in statements to â€œMasrawyâ€ that he filed a grievance towards the college earlier than the Administrative Affairs of the Ministry of Schooling, explaining that the Giza training administration, when speaking with him, strain to not settle for the occasion and to punish the one that dedicated the crime, â€œThey may all be accountable, and the proper of a woman is not going to go away.â€ In keeping with the ladyâ€™s father.
Comply with Mark; He wrote a report within the Omraniya Division of Giza, No. 3038, of 2024, Omraniya Administrative Workplace, during which he accuses an worker of injuring his daughter whereas she was inside, after his daughter obtained the required therapy in a personal hospital.
The primary digital medical report revealed that the scholar, â€œCaroline,â€ suffered burns on the face and proper shoulder. The case was introduced to a plastic surgeon, who determined that the therapy interval can be roughly 3 weeks till did the burns recover from.

title: La selecciÃ³n de fÃºtbol femenino se da un baÃ±o de masas pensando ya en ParÃ­s 2024
text: La selecciÃ³n femenina, ganadora de la Liga de Naciones seis meses despuÃ©s de conseguir vencer en la Copa del Mundo, se dio un baÃ±o de masas al ser recibida por miles de aficionados a grito de "Â¡Campeonas"!, este jueves en el Palacio de Vistalegre en Madrid con la mirada puesta en los Juegos OlÃ­mpicos de ParÃ­s, siguiente objetivo del combinado espaÃ±ol. "Es un placer estar aquÃ­ con todos vosotros con este tÃ­tulo que han conseguido estas grandÃ­simas jugadoras. Hoy es un dÃ­a para sentirnos felices y agradecidas. Ahora a disfrutarlo y vamos a por los Juegos OlÃ­mpicos", declarÃ³ la seleccionadora Montse TomÃ© que quiso agradecer el gran papel que desempeÃ±a su cuerpo tÃ©cnico y sobre todo, a las jugadoras. "Agradecer personalmente a mi cuerpo tÃ©cnico porque estoy rodada de ocho personas que sin ellos no serÃ­a posible todo el trabajo para conseguir que las futbolistas saquen su mÃ¡ximo rendimiento. TambiÃ©n, a todo el staff que trabajan con cariÃ±o, profesionalidad y detalle para que todo tenga el orden ideal y a todas estas futbolistas porque ellas son las verdaderas protagonistas de este juego", afirmÃ³ TomÃ© ante una grada entregada con banderas y camisetas de la selecciÃ³n, que escuchÃ³ cÃ³mo Irene Paredes les animaba a seguir apoyando al equipo. "Es importante sentir vuestro apoyo y por nuestra parte decir que vamos a por mÃ¡s a si que os necesitamos para eso tambiÃ©n", comentÃ³ la jugadora del Barcelona. La selecciÃ³n se proclamÃ³ campeona de la primera ediciÃ³n de la Liga de las Naciones tras vencer por 2-0 a Francia, en la Cartuja ante 32.657 espectadores, gracias a los goles de Aitana BonmatÃ­ en la primera parte y de Mariona Caldentey en el minuto 53 que permitiÃ³ al combinado nacional alzarse con el trofeo. Previamente, tras ganar en semifinales a PaÃ­ses Bajos por 3-0, ya habÃ­an logrado certificar el objetivo de la clasificaciÃ³n a los Juegos OlÃ­mpicos. Como homenaje a las madres, cada jugadora fue nombrada por su nombre y sus dos apellidos mientras la aficiÃ³n vitoreaba a cada una de ellas llegando al punto Ã¡lgido cuando Jennifer Hermoso, con el trofeo en mano, entro al escenario con los aplausos y Ã¡nimos de la grada que se cayÃ³ a bajo a grito de "Â¡Jenni, Jenni!". Otra de las mÃ¡s aclamadas fue Aitana BonmatÃ­, MVP de la Final a Cuatro. La fiesta, que comenzÃ³ a las 17.00 horas con entrada libre hasta que se completÃ³ el aforo y contÃ³ con mÃºsica en directo de grandes artistas invitados como Marlena, en dos ocasiones, Michenlo, Delaporte y Elena Farga, tuvo su punto Ã¡lgido cuando entraron las jugadoras y el cuerpo tÃ©cnico alrededor de las 19.00 horas y se cerrÃ³ con el We are the Champions como es habitual en este tipo de acontecimientos. ðŸŽ¤ ð—¯ð—®ð—¶ð—¹ð—®ð—ºð—¼ð—¿ð—²ð—»ð—® con la colaboraciÃ³n entreâ€” RFEF (@rfef) [@marlenaoficial]y [@Jennihermoso]ðŸ¤£ ðŸ“º SÃ­guelo en [https://t.co/fYiXcuLlfw] [#JugarLucharYGanar]I [#UWNL] [pic.twitter.com/GGpU7k0U5m] [February 29, 2024] En la maÃ±ana de este jueves, la selecciÃ³n fue recibida por la presidenta del Congreso, junto a los portavoces de los grupos, en el SalÃ³n de los Pasos Perdidos, desde el que se trasladaron al hemiciclo, donde ocuparon los escaÃ±os y se fotografiaron con los diputados presentes. Posteriormente, el combinado nacional tuvo el reconocimiento en el Palacio de la Moncloa del presidente del Gobierno, Pedro SÃ¡nchez, que recibiÃ³ una camiseta con los nombres de todas las protagonistas del duelo contra Francia y las Ã¡nimo a conseguir una medalla en los Juegos OlÃ­mpicos de ParÃ­s que se celebran en los meses de julio y agosto y serÃ¡n los primeros juegos de su historia.

author: Irina Bucur
title: Butler pastor charged with assaulting congregant he mentored â€“ Butler Eagle
text:
A Butler pastor previously accused of sexually assaulting two underage girls was charged last week with misdemeanor indecent assault of a female congregant he offered to mentor through a theology program, according to police documents. Charging documents acquired Thursday said Herman Rushing, pastor of By His Grace Christian Ministries, assaulted the woman in the office of the church after working on a packet meant to prepare her for ministry school.
Rushing, 67, is accused of touching the woman without her consent, grabbing her face and attempting to kiss her.
The victim disclosed to state police Rushing began rubbing her shoulders and kissing her neck while working on the packet. As she attempted to move away from him and jumped up, Rushing blocked her from the door.
As Rushing blocked the door, the victim said she â€œfroze,â€ according to police. Rushing then groped her, grabbed her face and attempted to kiss her. The victim stated she pulled away from Rushing and was able to leave the building.
The woman told police Rushing told her he was chosen by God to minister.
Rushing also faces charges for allegedly assaulting two girls under the age of 16 on multiple occasions.
He is accused of assaulting a 13-year-old girl over the span of several years, beginning when she was 10 years old.
A 16-year-old girl also disclosed Rushing had touched her inappropriately over the past year, police said, citing two instances that took place in his home.
Rushing was charged earlier this month with felonies and misdemeanors of indecent assault, corruption of minors and child endangerment and placed in Butler County Prison in lieu of $75,000 bail, which was reduced to $50,000 after he waived his preliminary hearing Dec. 21 before District Judge Kevin Oâ€™Donnell. He remains incarcerated.

author: Anonym
title: "There are still sounds of war here": the IDF eased the restrictions - and the residents of the Otaf are still debating - voila! News - The Limited Times
text:
Netanyahu to heads of authorities from the surrounding area: determined to restore the kibbutzim
"They did it a little too late," stated Tamir Peretz of Sderot who heard about the Home Front Command's decision to ease the restrictions on the settlements surrounding Gaza and allow classes to be held.
According to him, "it was possible to do this before, already a month and a half ago it was possible to return to emergency routine. This is good for the residents and good for the city of Sderot, that way it will be possible to move it."
The Home Front Command's announcement, about changing the defense policy in the surrounding settlements, caught some of the residents off guard.
Some of them have already returned to their homes, some are in transit and the rest are still waiting to see where the war will go.
"It seems a little strange to me that the Home Front Command issues announcements by surprise without preparing the authorities," said Moran Hajabi, a resident of Yachini, after receiving the news.
"They are creating confusion among the residents, the authorities are trying to prepare the infrastructure in front of the residents, and the Home Front Command comes and flashes a message that conveys instability."
A destroyed house in Kibbutz Bari, January 1, 2023/Uri Sela
The security establishment understands that despite the changes in the defense policy, opening the education system in the surrounding settlements, in the shadow of the continuation of the fighting, is a challenge.
Army officials claimed that the changes were made in coordination with the authorities: "There are settlements that have already returned, and some of the solutions were given within the kibbutzim. There are additional kibbutzim that want to return."
Beyond the question of security, the residents of the enclave also face the psychological impact of living in a combat zone.
The army emphasized: "We said that from a security point of view it is possible to return, the decision is ultimately up to the individual, the family and the community. Just as there are families who do not want to return for the sake of the mental security of the children, there are many families who want to return. Last Friday, Or Haner voted in the kibbutz and decided that the kibbutz is returning The communities that decided to return must open the schools."
Kibbutz Nahal Oz destroyed after the terrorist attack by Hamas.
October 20, 2023./Flash 90, Jonathan Zindel
do not miss
Biden signed an unprecedented presidential order against settlers who attack Palestinians
Ben Gvir has introduced a spirit into the police force - and it is evil and dangerous
Report: A gunman is holding hostages in a factory in Turkey - in protest of the war in Gaza
Uncompromising sex life - "It saved my sex and relationship"
Therefore, it seems that the residents of the Otaf are still studying the decision made by the Home Front Command and the Southern Command and the feelings are mixed.
"If the state is able to allow to return and not by force - then excellent," said Yaron Samimi of Shukda.
"People need to be given the time and the options. It is impossible to return residents without educational institutions. And those who are not yet ready to return should be given the option."
On the other hand, there are also those who think that the return to the surrounding settlements is still premature.
"I'm in favor of giving the residents the option to return, but they also need to be synchronized," said one of the heads of the authorities in Otef who chose to remain anonymous.
"There are several plans of the army, of Takuma and more, but not all the state bodies are synchronized. The state must allow those who started the school year outside the envelope to finish. There are still noises of war here. We could wait until we understand where the war is going."

Gaza war
War of Iron Swords

author: Click4r Solutions Private Limited
title: Refractive Lens Exchange: The Future Of Vision Improvement | Click4R
text: Refractive Lens Exchange: The Future Of Vision Improvement Posted On: April 11, 2024, 10:50 pm Content Writer-Austin Brink Visualize a future where you no more need to depend on glasses or get in touch with lenses to see plainly. A future where vision correction is as simple as a quick, pain-free treatment. Well, that future is closer than you may assume. Introducing refractive lens exchange, a revolutionary technique to fixing your vision that might transform the means you see the globe. But exactly what is refractive lens exchange, and why is it took into consideration the future of vision modification? In this conversation, we will certainly discover the advantages, the procedure, and the potential risks of refractive lens exchange, giving you a glance right into what lies in advance for those seeking more clear vision. The Advantages of Refractive Lens Exchange Refractive Lens Exchange provides numerous advantages for people seeking vision correction. By changing your all-natural lens with a man-made intraocular lens, this treatment can fix a vast array of vision problems. One of the major advantages of refractive lens exchange is the renovation in visual acuity. Whether you're nearsighted, farsighted, or have astigmatism, this procedure can substantially enhance your capacity to see plainly without depending on glasses or contact lenses. In addition, refractive lens exchange can likewise avoid the progression of particular eye problems, such as cataracts. https://www.ophthalmologytimes.com/view/raising-the-bar-for-premium-pterygium-procedure indicates that not just will you accomplish much better vision, yet you'll additionally have a lowered risk of creating cataracts in the future. With refractive lens exchange, you can take pleasure in enhanced vision and a higher quality of life. The Procedure for Refractive Lens Exchange When undergoing refractive lens exchange, the cosmetic surgeon will certainly begin by making a small laceration in your cornea. This enables them to access the lens of your eye and remove it. Below are five vital actions involved in the treatment: - The specialist will meticulously separate the lens making use of ultrasound waves or lasers. - After getting rid of the lens, they'll put a brand-new fabricated lens, called an intraocular lens (IOL), right into your eye. - The IOL is designed to correct your specific vision problems, such as nearsightedness, farsightedness, or astigmatism. - Once the new lens is in location, the cosmetic surgeon will close the laceration with little stitches or self-sealing strategies. - The whole treatment generally takes less than thirty minutes and is typically performed on an outpatient basis. Following these steps, refractive lens exchange can give you with improved vision and reduce your dependancy on glasses or contact lenses. Prospective Risks of Refractive Lens Exchange Before undergoing refractive lens exchange, it's important to recognize the potential threats associated with the procedure. While refractive lens exchange is generally taken into consideration risk-free, like any operation, there are threats entailed. One potential risk is infection, which can occur if bacteria gets in the eye during or after the surgical treatment. One more danger is the development of boosted intraocular pressure, which can lead to glaucoma. Additionally, there's relevant web site of experiencing corneal edema, which is the swelling of the cornea. Various other potential risks consist of retinal detachment, macular edema, and loss of vision. It's critical to discuss these risks with your doctor and consider them versus the possible benefits before deciding. Conclusion So there you have it, individuals! Refractive lens exchange is genuinely the future of vision adjustment. With its many benefits and improvements in innovation, this treatment uses a life-changing solution for those battling with their vision. But remember, every increased has its thorns. While refractive lens exchange might bring clarity, it is necessary to be knowledgeable about the potential dangers included. So, before taking the leap, evaluate the benefits and drawbacks, and talk to your eye doctor. After you can look here , far better secure than sorry! author: Newsweek
title: How Winter Weather Could Impede New Yearâ€™s Travel â€“ DNyuz
text:
New Yearâ€™s Eve is already a perilous night for motorists, and winter weather could make the next few days even more difficult for travelers in some parts of the U.S.
Car crash fatalities jump on New Yearâ€™s Eve, largely attributed to drunk driving accidents, and although the forecast is mostly clear, poor weather conditions this year could contribute to hazardous road conditions for holiday travelers in some areas.
Multiple states faced hazardous holiday travel over Christmas when a blustery winter storm brought blizzard conditions to Nebraska and South Dakota. The storm has moved eastward, with 12 states expecting snow over the weekend , including multiple states in the Midwest, northern Alabama and Georgia, and New York and Maine, as well as Vermont, Virginia and West Virginia.
However, much of the snow was expected to fall on Friday and Saturday, leaving Sunday through Tuesday mostly clear for travelers, according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).
â€œThe outlook is rosy for most travelers at the start of 2024. A sprawling area of high pressure will keep most of the country dry,â€ an NOAA report said Tuesday. â€œHigh temperatures are expected to be near or above average for much of the country through the first half of next week as Arctic air stays bottled up to the north.â€
However, the snow in northern Maine from Saturday may have â€œlingering effectsâ€ that â€œcould impact travel into the New Year,â€ NOAA public affairs specialist and meteorologist Erica Grow Cei told Newsweek , although major interstates in the region are unlikely to have any weather-related issues. She added that snow showers enhanced by the lake effect are likely for the Midwest on Sunday, with an inch of snow forecast in the Great Lakes region and 2 to 4 inches predicted in upstate New York and northern Wisconsin.
The NOAA report added that precipitation will be scarce, although showers are possible on Monday from the lower Mississippi Valley to the southern and central Appalachian mountains.
â€œSome snow is possible in higher mountain elevations, but since thereâ€™s not much cold air in place, the majority of precipitation is likely to fall as rain. Looking ahead to Tuesday, the outlook is dry for most folks traveling east of the Rockies,â€ the report said.
Rain showers are expected along the West Coast on Monday, with a threat of snow in the Cascades and the northern Sierras.
â€œHowever, the impact on travel should be low, as the snow is likely confined to elevations above the mountain passes and major interstates,â€ NOAA reported.
Meanwhile, air travel could be interrupted by a low ceiling on Monday and Tuesday in and out of Seattle, San Francisco, Los Angeles and San Diego.
â€œJanuary 2nd could also be gusty at airport hubs along the East Coast, including Atlanta, Washington DC, and New York City,â€ the report said.
More motorists are impacted by winter weather in the days leading up to the new year, with the National Weather Service issuing weather advisories for five states on Friday. Parts of Alaska, California, Maine, Nevada and Tennessee will be impacted by high wind, as well as snow and freezing rain that could reduce visibility in the early part of the weekend.
Uncommon Knowledge
Newsweek is committed to challenging conventional wisdom and finding connections in the search for common ground.
Newsweek is committed to challenging conventional wisdom and finding connections in the search for common ground.
The post How Winter Weather Could Impede New Yearâ€™s Travel appeared first on Newsweek .

author: Agencia EFE
title: La iglesia mÃ¡s antigua del mundo, refugio de papas y reliquias, cumple 1,700 aÃ±os - El Nuevo DÃ­a
text: La ArchibasÃ­lica fue la primera iglesia abierta por el emperador Constantino tras la persecuciÃ³n de los cristianos durante mÃ¡s de dos siglos 31 de mayo de 2024 - 7:37 AM La ArchibasÃ­lica fue la primera iglesia abierta por el emperador Constantino tras la persecuciÃ³n de los cristianos durante mÃ¡s de dos siglos 31 de mayo de 2024 - 7:37 AM Roma â€” La BasÃ­lica de San Juan de LetrÃ¡n, cuyos muros han resguardado a 233 papas, han visto caer el Imperio Romano, han sobrevivido a atentados, bombardeos y saqueos y guardan en su interior reliquias de enorme valor para la tradiciÃ³n cristiana, cumple 1,700 aÃ±os como la iglesia mÃ¡s antigua del mundo. La â€œmadre y guÃ­aâ€ de todas las iglesias es la sede del obispo de [Roma](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/roma/), el Papa, y por ello la de mayor rango entre las cuatro basÃ­licas mayores de la capital italiana, las que cualquier peregrino que se precie debe visitar para obtener el perdÃ³n, ademÃ¡s de una fuente inagotable de riqueza artÃ­stica con la impronta de su larguÃ­sima historia. La ArchibasÃ­lica del SantÃ­simo Salvador del Mundo y de los Santos Juan Bautista y Juan Evangelista -su nombre completo- fue â€œla primera iglesia abierta al pueblo de Dios por el emperador Constantino tras la persecuciÃ³nâ€ de los cristianos durante mÃ¡s de dos siglos, explica a EFE el sacerdote Marco Frisina, director del coro de la DiÃ³cesis de Roma que canta en las celebraciones de la basÃ­lica. Gracias a Constantino, que convirtiÃ³ el cristianismo en la religiÃ³n oficial del Imperio, los cristianos abandonaron la clandestinidad y gozaron de su primer lugar pÃºblico para rezar, consagrado en el aÃ±o 324 por el papa san Silvestre. Hoy aÃºn se respira su fuerte conexiÃ³n con la Antigua Roma: desde la imponente puerta de bronce proveniente de la â€˜Curia Giuliaâ€™, el Senado romano, a su propio nombre, LetrÃ¡n, el de una noble familia romana caÃ­da en desgracia durante el mandato de NerÃ³n (37-68 d.C). Hasta el siglo XIV, cuando la sede del papado se trasladÃ³ a la localidad francesa de AviÃ±Ã³n, San Juan fue el corazÃ³n de la cristiandad, la residencia del papa en el Palacio Lateranense, hoy la sede de la DiÃ³cesis de Roma. AdemÃ¡s del templo, el recinto se completa con el imponente claustro de Pietro Vassaleto del siglo XIII y el baptisterio, el primero de forma octogonal y guÃ­a para los posteriores, como el de Florencia, construyendo asÃ­ un puente artÃ­stico de la Antigua Roma al Barroco, pasando por el Renacimiento. El secreto para seguir en pie durante 1,700 aÃ±os reside en el uso de â€œunos materiales extraordinariosâ€ y en que antes â€œtodo se hacÃ­a sin prisa, para la eternidadâ€, sin olvidar que â€œsiempre ha habido un trabajo de restauraciÃ³n y protecciÃ³n. Esta catedral siempre ha estado custodiada, salvo durante el perÃ­odo de AviÃ±Ã³nâ€, sostiene Frisina. Centro neurÃ¡lgico del cristianismo durante siglos, San Juan de LetrÃ¡n guarda infinidad de valiosas reliquias reunidas en el â€œTesoro del Sancta Sanctorumâ€, en la que fuera la capilla privada de los papas hasta el Renacimiento. Como la â€˜Escalera Santaâ€™, los peldaÃ±os del Pretorio de JerusalÃ©n que, segÃºn la tradiciÃ³n, subiÃ³ JesÃºs de Nazaret para su proceso y que fueron traÃ­dos a Roma por santa Elena, la madre del emperador Constantino, y que cientos de fieles suben cada dÃ­a de rodillas como penitencia. TambiÃ©n el icono â€œaquiropoetaâ€, una imagen de Jesucristo pintada sobre una tabla que la tradiciÃ³n asegura que no fue creada por la mano humana, asÃ­ como una tabla sobre la que San Pedro oficiÃ³ la primera â€˜misaâ€™ o parte de la mesa en la que se celebrÃ³ la Ãšltima Cena. Durante sus 1,700 aÃ±os de vida la archibasÃ­lica ha sobrevivido a numerosas vicisitudes que han amenazado su supervivencia y que agrandan la Ã©pica que rodea a la catedral de Roma. En su larga historia, Roma sufriÃ³ infinidad de saqueos que tambiÃ©n afectaron a la basÃ­lica lateranense por parte de galos, visigodos, bÃ¡rbaros, germanos e incluso el perpetrado en 1527 por el ejÃ©rcito imperial de Carlos I de EspaÃ±a y V de Alemania. Pero tambiÃ©n ha visto cÃ³mo las casi 10,000 bombas lanzadas durante la II Guerra Mundial causaron mÃ¡s de un millar de muertos en la Ciudad Eterna, o como un coche bomba colocado muy cerca del templo por la mafia siciliana Cosa Nostra provocÃ³ casi una decena de heridos. Las celebraciones por el 1,700 aniversario devolverÃ¡n a esta iglesia parte de su esplendor, â€œcomo una seÃ±ora que va a ponerse guapa para una fiestaâ€, dice Frisina, y se espera que a finales de aÃ±o el papa abra su Puerta Santa para el Jubileo de 2025, el Ãºltimo por ahora de los eventos de un lugar por el que no parece pasar el tiempo. title: VIDÃ‰O - "J'Ã©tais effrayÃ©" : les habitants du BrÃ©sil frappÃ©s par de nouvelles pluies dÃ©vastatrices
text: Au BrÃ©sil, de nouvelles pluies diluviennes se sont abattues dans le sud du pays.Les intempÃ©ries ont dÃ©jÃ  fait plus de 100 morts, 130 personnes sont portÃ©es disparues.Des opÃ©rations de secours ont dÃ» Ãªtre interrompues Ã  cause de la montÃ©e des eaux. L'image est saisissante. Pendant plus de 24 heures, un cheval nommÃ© Caramel, est restÃ© perchÃ© en Ã©quilibre sur un toit, au milieu d'un quartier sous les eaux comme le montre la vidÃ©o du 20H de TF1 en tÃªte de cet article. Il aura fallu l'intervention de vÃ©tÃ©rinaires pour secourir l'animal. Ã€ l'aÃ©roport de Porto Alegre au BrÃ©sil, les vols sont annulÃ©s car les pistes ont disparu. Et la pelouse du stade s'apparente Ã  une piscine de boue. Lire aussi BrÃ©sil : les inondations sans prÃ©cÃ©dent dans le sud du pays font au moins 100 morts et 374 blessÃ©s Un homme a failli se noyer, il doit sa vie Ã  une grille. "J'Ã©tais effrayÃ©, mais j'ai essayÃ© de me calmer. Je n'avais pas pied, et si je paniquais, Ã§a allait Ãªtre pire", raconte-t-il encore sous le choc. Des Ã©vacuations ont Ã©tÃ© effectuÃ©es toute la journÃ©e de mercredi, en plein centre-ville, que ce soit avec les blindÃ©s de l'armÃ©e, en tracteur ou Ã  jet ski Ã  la force des bras. L'opÃ©ration s'est rÃ©alisÃ©e dans l'odeur infecte de l'eau stagnante. Plus de 160.000 personnes ont fui lÃ  oÃ¹ elles le peuvent vers les hauteurs, quitte Ã  dormir sur les autoroutes. "Au moins, c'est haut ici, il n'y a pas d'eau, le seul problÃ¨me c'est la pluie", tÃ©moigne un sinistrÃ©. Dans ces inondations, 107 personnes sont mortes et plus d'une centaine sont toujours portÃ©es disparues.

author: ACCESS Newswire
title: Onco-Innovations' Inka Health Innovative AI-Driven Oncology Study Paves the Way for New Research | User | bigspringherald.com
text:
VANCOUVER, BC / ACCESS Newswire / February 27, 2025 / Onco-Innovations Limited (CSE: ONCO )(OTCQB: ONNVF )(Frankfurt: W1H ,WKN: A3EKSZ ) (" Onco " or the " Company ") is pleased to provide information regarding its wholly-owned subsidiary, Inka Health ("Inka"), which has made significant strides in advancing AI-driven oncology research by leading a transformative study protocol 1 published in medRxiv in September 2024 , focused on AI-generated synthetic patient models. This innovative research aims to advance the study of oncology by creating synthetic patient data, thereby leveraging advanced machine learning techniques to overcome critical challenges, particularly in the study of rare cancers where traditional patient data is often unavailable or difficult to obtain.
The study, entitled, " External Control Arm with Synthetic Real-world Data for Comparative Oncology using Single Trial Arm Evidence (ECLIPSE): A Case Study using Lung-MAP S1400I " is led by Dr. Winson Cheung, Medical Advisor at Inka Health and Professor of Medicine at the University of Calgary, and brought together an esteemed team of oncology experts, including Inka Health co-founders Dr. Paul Arora and Dr. Alind Gupta, along with a consortium of world-renowned cancer researchers and private sector partners (Subsalt and Quantify Health). This exciting initiative seeks to develop synthetic patient cohorts using AI technology, a core element of digital twin technology, to address gaps in oncology research and accelerate clinical trial design by quickly generating comparator arms for trials. The Company believes that this is particularly critical in the rare cancer setting where randomizing patients to control arms (comparison groups without the new treatment) 2 is often infeasible. Ultimately, this approach aims to improve the pace and effectiveness of cancer treatments.
This study, led by Inka Health, has the potential to impact not only Onco-Innovation's cancer research but also the broader healthcare landscape by providing a scalable, data-driven solution to the challenges of studying rare and hard-to-treat cancers. As part of this ongoing initiative, Inka is working to expand its proprietary AI-driven platform, SynoGraph, which enhances patient stratification, improves clinical trial efficiency, and advances precision oncology solutions. By incorporating synthetic real-world data, SynoGraph aims to offer the pharmaceutical and biotech industries a powerful tool to speed up drug development and regulatory processes.
" The ability to create synthetic patient models using AI is an exciting milestone for oncology research. Traditional data limitations have long hindered progress, especially for rare cancers where patient data is scarce. With this technology, we can simulate diverse patient populations, with the potential to improve how clinical trials are designed, " said Paul Arora, CEO of Inka Health.
"AI-driven synthetic patient models represent a potentially major leap in oncology research. By generating high-fidelity digital replicas of real patients, we can overcome data gaps that have historically slowed advancements, particularly for rare cancers and underrepresented populations. This approach has the potential to enhance clinical trial design, optimize treatment strategies, and accelerate the development of life-saving therapies, " said Winson Cheung, Professor of Medicine at the University of Calgary and Medical Advisor at Inka Health.
About Onco-Innovations Limited
Onco-Innovations is a Canadian-based company dedicated to cancer research and treatment, specializing in oncology. Onco's mission is to prevent and cure cancer through pioneering research and innovative solutions. The company has secured an exclusive worldwide license to patented technology that targets solid tumours, setting new standards in cancer treatment. Onco's commitment to excellence and innovation drives it to develop advanced therapies that improve patient outcomes and offer hope in the fight against cancer.
